<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation for the apprehending of James Duke of Monmouth, Ford Lord Gray, Sir Thomas Armestrong knight, and Robert Ferguson England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to His most Sacred Majesty, Edinburgh : 1683.
Dated at end: Given at our court at Whitehall this twenty eighth day of June, 1683. In the five and thirtieth year of our reign. Arms 234; Steele notation: Ford Law. him. Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C.
=======

printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to His most Sacred Majesty, Edinburgh : 1683.
Dated at end: Given at our court at Whitehall this twenty eighth day of June, 1683. In the five and thirtieth year of our reign. Arms 234; Steele notation: Ford Law. him. Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C.
